title: Coronation Street spoilers: Shock death after a violent prison riot?
text:
David Platt (Jack P Shepherd) has had plenty to deal with in Coronation Street over the past couple of months, but things are set to get a whole lot worse for the young man in the coming episodes, when he finds himself involved in a violent prison riot. Will someone lose their life as a result?

A riot breaks out at the prison in upcoming scenes, and David — shocked by what’s transpiring — retreats to his cell.

However, matters are made worse when Abe drags a terrified Josh (Ryan Clayton) into David’s cell, before handing the young man a pair of scissors and informing him to do as he pleases with his rapist.

David tells Abe that he wants to deal with Josh alone — will he take advantage of the riot and exact violent revenge?

Meanwhile, Shona (Julia Goulding) is horrified when the riot is shown on the news, as the family watch on in horror.

Later, David rings his girlfriend, and informs her that Josh has been stabbed and that she needs to get him a lawyer.

Is David responsible for the attack on Josh? Or did the rapist simply get caught up in the riot?

The biggest question, of course, is: does Josh die?

If so, David could be in a whole lot of trouble and, with him already serving a prison sentence, a murder charge would be the last thing he needs right now.

One to watch: Monday 21st October at 8:30pm on ITV.
